verbose_text: The heart 's ability to tolerate and withstand ischemia and reperfusion can be constrained by myocardial insulin resistance by reducing glucose uptake as well as the synthesis of glycogen and glycolysis, all of which contribute to adenosine triphosphate (ATP) delivery in the ischemic heart for cellular metabolism [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: glycogen and glycolysis, all of which contribute to adenosine triphosphate
